title: How to Add a Google Account to a Mac

steps.title: Click the Apple menu and select System Preferences.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu and select System Preferences . The Apple menu is the black, apple-shaped icon in the upper-left of your screen.

steps.title: It's the blue "@" icon near the center of the Preferences window.
steps.content: It's the blue "@" icon near the center of the Preferences window.

steps.title: You'll see Google on the right panel.
steps.content: You'll see Google on the right panel.

steps.title: Once entered, you'll be asked to enter your password.
steps.content: Once entered, you'll be asked to enter your password.

steps.title: Once your password is accepted, you'll be able to choose your preferences.
steps.content: Once your password is accepted, you'll be able to choose your preferences.

steps.title: Click on checkboxes next to applications.
steps.content: Click on checkboxes next to applications. Once you've made your selections, the Mac applications you select will be able to use your Google account. Your Google account will now be accessible via any of the apps you selected. For example, if you checked Mail, Calendar, and Contacts, your Google email, calendar data and contact information will be synced with the corresponding Mac apps.
